info.name: gps-reference-api (SANDBOX)
info.description:
The following is the standard API for creating references for referenced payments.

#### JWT

The calls to this API use a JWT that must be used in the Authorization header. To obtain it, it is necessary to use the credentials previously shared by the Gestopago team.

The JWT obtained has a lifetime of 24 hrs. Any call with an expired JWT will cause error.

#### Key Points

This token must be used to authenticate all subsequent calls to the API, where it must be added in the Authorization header in the form of a Bearer token.

`Authorization: Bearer`

#### Structure of responses

All API responses follow a uniform structure to facilitate the interpretation of results, both in cases of success and error. The general structure consists of three key elements:

``` json
{
     "response_code": "code",
     "response_message": "message",
     "data": {
          // Specific data of the response according to the endpoint.
     }
}

 ```

request.description:
### POST v1/authenticate

This endpoint allows authentication by obtaining a JWT. This endpoint requires the username and password previously shared with the implementer.

#### Request Body

- `username` (string) - Previous shared username
    
- `password` (string) - Previous shared password.
    

#### Response

The response will be in JSON format and will have the following schema:

- `data` (object) - The data object containing the user's authentication token and the timestamp of token creation.
    
    - `token` (string) - The authentication token generated for the user.
        
    - `createdAt` (string) - The timestamp indicating when the token was created.
        

#### Example Response

``` json
{
    "responseCode": 200,
    "responseMessage": "Authentication successful",
    "data": {
        "token": "token",
        "createdAt": "timestamp"
    }
}

 ```

### POST v1/payment

This API endpoint allows you to make a payment.

#### Request Body

- `externalId` (string, max 255): Unique identifier of this payment by the implementer.
    
- `amount` (double): Payment amount.
    
- `description` (string, max 255): Payment description.
    
- `dueDate` (string): Payment due date in format "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss"
    
- `callbackURL` (string, max 255): URL to which you should report when this payment has been registered in any of the Puntored points.
    

#### Response

The response will be in JSON format and will have the following schema:

- `data` (object) - The data object containing .
    
    - `paymentId` (string) - Unique identifier of the payment by puntored.
        
    - `reference` (string) - Unique reference that must be given to the client to make the payment in any of the physical points of the Puntored network.
        
    - `amount` (double) - Payment amount.
        
    - `description` (string) - Payment description.
        
    - `creationDate` (string) - The timestamp indicating when the reference was created.
        
    - `status` (string) - "01" created or "-1" not created
        
    - `message` (string) - Message detailing the possible cause of error if any.
        

``` json
{
    "responseCode": 201,
    "responseMessage": "Payment created successfully",
    "data": {
        "paymentId": 1,
        "reference": "PRV124101801F3CD80866AF94D9946",
        "amount": 100.1,
        "description": "Payment description",
        "creationDate": "2024-10-18 18:17:21",
        "status": "01",
        "message": "Payment created successfully"
    }
}

 ```

response.name: Validation Errors

request.description:
### GET v1/payment/{reference}/{paymentId}

This endpoint allows you to check the status of a payment. The possible statuses of a payment are as follows.

- "01" Created
    
- "02" Paid
    
- "03" Canceled
    
- "04" Expired
    

#### URL Params

- `reference` : Unique identifier of this payment by the implementer.
    
- `paymentId` : Payment amount.
    

#### Response

The response will be in JSON format and will have the following schema:

- `data` (object) - The data object containing.
    
    - `paymentId` (string) - Unique identifier of the payment by puntored.
        
    - `reference` (string) - Unique reference that must be given to the client to make the payment in any of the physical points of the Puntored network.
        
    - `amount` (double) - Payment amount.
        
    - `description` (string) - Payment description.
        
    - `dueDate` (string): Payment due date in format "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss"
        
    - `status` (string) - "01", "02", "03", "04"
        
    - `callBackURL` (string) - URL to which you should report when this payment has been registered in any of the puntored points.
        
    - `callBackACKID` (string) - Value of the Acknowledge id delivered by the implementer.
        
    - `cancelDescription` (string) - Reason for cancellation if any.
        
    - `authorizationNumber` (string) - Authorization number, only if the state is paid
        
    - `paymentDate` (string) - Date of payment in format "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss", only if the state is paid
        

``` json
{
    "responseCode": 200,
    "responseMessage": "Payment verified successfully",
    "data": {
        "paymentId": 1,
        "amount": 100.0,
        "reference": "PRV124102161484253FC12DDEB8512",
        "description": "Payment description",
        "dueDate": "2024-10-30 11:59:00",
        "status": "02",
        "callBackURL": "https://localhost:8080/callback",
        "callbackACKID": "",
        "cancelDescription": "",
        "authorizationNumber": "477846",
        "paymentDate": "2024-10-21 21:23:55"
    }
}

 ```

response.name: Not Found

request.description:
### GET v1/payment/search?

The objective of this endpoint is to obtain the list of payments created in a period of time. This method can filter by the following parameters of creation date, payment date and status.

#### Request Parameters

- `startCreationDate` (string) - The start date for payment creation.
    
- `endCreationDate` (string) - The end date for payment creation.
    
- `startPaymentDate` (string) - The start date for payment.
    
- `endPaymentDate` (string) - The end date for payment.
    
- `status` (string) - The status of the payment.
    

#### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following schema:

- `data` (object) - The data object containing.
    
    - `content` Object list.
        
        - `paymentId` (string) - Unique identifier of the payment by puntored.
            
        - `reference` (string) - Unique reference that must be given to the client to make the payment in any of the physical points of the Puntored network.
            
        - `amount` (double) - Payment amount.
            
        - `description` (string) - Payment description.
            
        - `dueDate` (string): Payment due date in format "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss"
            
        - `status` (string) - "01", "02", "03"
            
        - `callBackURL` (string) - URL to which you should report when this payment has been registered in any of the puntored points.
            
        - `callBackACKID` (string) - Value of the Acknowledge id delivered by the implementer.
            
        - `cancelDescription` (string) - Reason for cancellation if any.
            
        - `authorizationNumber` (string) - Authorization number, only if the state is paid
            
        - `paymentDate` (string) - Date of payment in format "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss", only if the state is paid
            

``` json
{
    "responseCode": 200,
    "responseMessage": "Payments retrieved successfully",
    "data": {
        "content": [
            {
                "paymentId": 1,
                "amount": 100.0,
                "reference": "PRV124102161484253FC12DDEB8512",
                "description": "Payment description",
                "dueDate": "2024-10-30 11:59:00",
                "status": "02",
                "callBackURL": "https://localhost:8080/callback",
                "callbackACKID": "",
                "cancelDescription": "",
                "authorizationNumber": "477846",
                "paymentDate": "2024-10-21 21:23:55"
            }
        ],
        "pageable": {
            "pageNumber": 0,
            "pageSize": 10,
            "sort": {
                "empty": true,
                "unsorted": true,
                "sorted": false
            },
            "offset": 0,
            "unpaged": false,
            "paged": true
        },
        "last": true,
        "totalElements": 1,
        "totalPages": 1,
        "size": 10,
        "number": 0,
        "sort": {
            "empty": true,
            "unsorted": true,
            "sorted": false
        },
        "first": true,
        "numberOfElements": 1,
        "empty": false
    }
}

 ```

request.description:
### PUT v1/payment/cancel

The purpose of this endpoint is to cancel a payment as long as the reference does not have the status = paid which means that it has not been paid.

#### Request Body

- `reference` (string): The reference of the payment to be cancelled.
    
- `status` (string): ‚Äú03‚Äù Canceled
    
- `updateDescription` (string): A message describing the reason for the cancellation.
    

#### Response

The response will be in JSON format and will have the following schema:

- `data` (object) - The data object containing .
    
    - `paymentId` (string) - Unique identifier of the payment by puntored.
        
    - `creationDate` (string) - The timestamp indicating when the reference was created.
        
    - `status` (string) - "03" cancelled
        
    - `reference` (string) - Unique reference that must be given to the client to make the payment in any of the physical points of the Puntored network.
        
    - `cancelDescription` (string) - Reason for cancellation if any.
        
    - `message` (string) - Message detailing the possible cause of error if any.
        
    - `updatedAt` (string) - Date of payment cancellation in format ‚Äúyyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss‚Äù.
        

##### Example Response Body

``` json
{
    "responseCode": 202,
    "responseMessage": "Payment canceled successfully",
    "data": {
        "paymentId": 2,
        "creationDate": "2024-10-21 21:56:56",
        "reference": "PRV124102152F2C61796B5D5F5E0BE",
        "status": "03",
        "message": "Payment canceled successfully",
        "cancelDescription": "Mensaje de cancelacion",
        "updatedAt": "2024-10-21 21:57:23"
    }
}

 ```

response.name: Cancel Success
Payment Not Found
Payment previously cancelled
